text: Peter Etebo (born on 9 November 1995), popularly known as Oghenekaro Peter Etebo, is a Nigerian footballer who has played in both the Nigerian national team and several foreign clubs. In July 2018, Peter Etebo distributed writing materials to school children from Caveginia Primary School and other primary schools in the area. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League National cup League cup Europe Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Feirense 2015–16 LigaPro 4 1 0 0 0 0 — 4 1 2016–17 Primeira Liga 23 2 1 0 3 1 — 27 3 2017–18 Primeira Liga 18 4 1 0 0 0 — 19 4 Total 45 7 2 0 3 1 — 50 8 Las Palmas (loan) 2017–18 La Liga 14 0 0 0 — — 14 0 Stoke City 2018–19 Championship 34 2 2 0 1 0 — 37 2 2019–20 Championship 11 0 0 0 3 0 — 14 0 2020–21 Championship 0 0 0 0 0 0 — 0 0 2021–22 Championship 0 0 0 0 0 0 — 0 0 Total 45 2 2 0 4 0 — 51 2 Getafe (loan) 2019–20 La Liga 10 1 1 0 — 0 0 11 1 Galatasaray (loan) 2020–21 Süper Lig 24 0 3 0 — 2 0 29 0 Watford (loan) 2021–22 Premier League 9 0 0 0 1 0 — 10 0 Aris (loan) 2022–23 Super League Greece 25 0 3 0 — — 28 0 Career total 171 10 11 0 8 1 2 0 193 11 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals Nigeria 2013 3 0 2016 4 1 2017 4 0 2018 11 0 2019 13 0 2020 2 0 2021 3 1 2022 4 1 Total 44 3 :Scores and results list Nigeria's goal tally first, score column indicates score after each Etebo goal.
